segment.source: Add and Remove a Product Key (Windows 10)
segment.target: Add and Remove a Product Key (Windows 10)

segment.source: Add and Remove a Product Key
segment.target: Add and Remove a Product Key

segment.source: Add and Remove a Product Key
segment.target: Add and Remove a Product Key

segment.source: Before you can use a Multiple Activation Key (MAK), retail, or KMS Host key (CSVLK) product key, you must first add it to the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) database.
segment.target: Before you can use a Multiple Activation Key (MAK), retail, or KMS Host key (CSVLK) product key, you must first add it to the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) database.

segment.source: To Add a Product Key
segment.target: To Add a Product Key

segment.source: Open VAMT.
segment.target: Open VAMT.

segment.source: In the left-side pane, right-click the Product Keys node to open the Actions menu.
segment.target: In the left-side pane, right-click the Product Keys node to open the Actions menu.

segment.source: Click Add product keys to open the Add Product Keys dialog box.
segment.target: Click Add product keys to open the Add Product Keys dialog box.

segment.source: In the Add Product Keys dialog box, select from one of the following methods to add product keys:
segment.target: In the Add Product Keys dialog box, select from one of the following methods to add product keys:

segment.source: To add product keys manually, click Enter product key(s) separated by line breaks, enter one or more product keys separated by line breaks, and click Add Key(s).
segment.target: To add product keys manually, click Enter product key(s) separated by line breaks, enter one or more product keys separated by line breaks, and click Add Key(s).

segment.source: To import a Comma Separated Values (CSV) file containing a list of product keys, click Select a product key file to import, browse to the file location, click Open to import the file, and then click Add Key(s).
segment.target: To import a Comma Separated Values (CSV) file containing a list of product keys, click Select a product key file to import, browse to the file location, click Open to import the file, and then click Add Key(s).

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are activating a large number of products with a MAK, you should refresh the activation count of the MAK, to ensure that the MAK can support the required number of activations.
segment.target: If you are activating a large number of products with a MAK, you should refresh the activation count of the MAK, to ensure that the MAK can support the required number of activations.

segment.source: In the product key list in the center pane, select the MAK and click Refresh product key data online in the right-side pane to contact Microsoft and retrieve the number of remaining activations for the MAK.
segment.target: In the product key list in the center pane, select the MAK and click Refresh product key data online in the right-side pane to contact Microsoft and retrieve the number of remaining activations for the MAK.

segment.source: This step requires Internet access.
segment.target: This step requires Internet access.

segment.source: You can only retrieve the remaining activation count for MAKs.
segment.target: You can only retrieve the remaining activation count for MAKs.

segment.source: Remove a Product Key
segment.target: Remove a Product Key

segment.source: To remove a product key from the list, simply select the key in the list and click Delete on the Selected Items menu in the right-side pane.
segment.target: To remove a product key from the list, simply select the key in the list and click Delete on the Selected Items menu in the right-side pane.

segment.source: Click Yes to confirm deletion of the product key.
segment.target: Click Yes to confirm deletion of the product key.

segment.source: Removing a product key from the VAMT database will not affect the activation state of any products or computers on the network.
segment.target: Removing a product key from the VAMT database will not affect the activation state of any products or computers on the network.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Manage Product Keys
